Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 16 ug/ml), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 16 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa PAO1 (MIC 16 ug/ml), and S. enterica serovar Typhi (MIC 8 ug/ml). Antibiofilm of P. gingivalis and inhibited virulence factor genes.Toxicity: hRBC: HC50> 1280 ug/ml (poor hemo.lytic). Likewise, it caused ~10% cell death at 20 ug/ml of HEK 293 and human epithelial fibroblasts (HEF) (to all the cells, there was an increased toxicity at high peptide concentrations).Chemotactic: DP7 recruited neutrophils, monocytes and macrophages to the site of infection. The adjuvant (DP7 + CpG oligonucleotide) induces chemokine/cytokine expression, enhances the antigen uptake by dendritic cells and upregulated surface marker expression in dendritic cells (Tian et al., 2021).The original has been merged with AP1030. 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Wu X, Wang Z, Li X, Fan Y, He G, Wan Y, Yu C, Tang J, Li M, Zhang X, Zhang H, Xiang R, Pan Y, Liu Y, Lu L, Yang L. 2014
Literature Information.Title: In vitro and in vivo activities of antimicrobial peptides developed using an amino acid-based activity prediction method.
